abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings convey satisfactory
            project outcome, likely sustainability, and substantial
            institutional development impacts, achieved through
            satisfactory performances by both the Bank and Borrower.
            Several lessons are drawn from the project. The inclusion of
            social partners  to build consensus, positively affected the
            implementation of the project, and the achievement of its
            objectives . But a systematic and ongoing consensus during
            implementation is needed, to build close consultations with
            beneficiaries, key representatives of employers'
            federation and labor unions during supervision, a factor
            that helped find institutional alternatives for a continuing
            dialogue. Moreover, understanding the political and social
            environment in which the Bank operates, thus demonstrating
            flexibility, becomes paramount, as in this case where the
            existing environment was not favorable to the introduction
            of an in-service training law, but the revision of the 1974
            Vocational Training Tax decree, was proposed and implemented
            instead.Nevertheless, to ensure the adequate implementation
            of innovative mechanisms, the Bank should consider investing
            early on, in improving the technical competencies of
            implementing agencies, through new follow-up instruments,
            such as impact studies for example, which have the greatest
            chance of being implemented, if technical training,
            seminars, etc., are held at project preparation and
            implementation. In addition a project that aims to improve
            private sector competitiveness by upgrading workers skills,
            requires close collaboration between all ministries involved
            in the sector - such as Industry and Vocational Training,
            and between Bank departments, e.g. Human Development and
            Private Sector Development.
